requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all data from backend APIs with no hard-coded or mock data
user_persona: A sales manager who needs to view real-time lead information.
user_goal: To see an accurate list of all sales leads pulled from the live database.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Leads Page
narrative_steps.description: Sarah logs into the CRM and navigates to the Sales Leads section expecting to see her team's latest prospects.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the /leads route.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend makes a GET request to /api/leads and displays the retrieved data in a table without any mocked entries.

requirement_tested: Backend API server that connects to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_persona: A system administrator responsible for deployment.
user_goal: To verify that the backend can successfully connect to the configured PostgreSQL instance.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Alex sets up the environment variables and starts the backend server to ensure database connectivity.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the backend directory after setting DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend initializes successfully, logs a successful connection to the PostgreSQL database, and exposes API endpoints.

requirement_tested: Database schema for storing sales leads with fields for contact information, status, and categorization
user_persona: A database developer validating the schema implementation.
user_goal: To confirm that the leads table matches the specified schema.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Database Table
narrative_steps.description: Devon inspects the database structure to make sure it aligns with the defined schema for sales leads.
narrative_steps.action: Connect to PostgreSQL and run '\d leads' or equivalent SQL command to describe the table.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The output shows the leads table with columns: id (SERIAL PK), name (VARCHAR), email (VARCHAR), phone (VARCHAR), status (VARCHAR), category (VARCHAR), created_at (TIMESTAMP), updated_at (TIMESTAMP).

requirement_tested: User interface for browsing and managing sales leads with search and filtering capabilities
user_persona: A sales representative looking for specific leads.
user_goal: To quickly locate leads based on partial name match and status.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Jamie types part of a client's name into the search bar to narrow down the list.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'John' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Leads whose names contain 'John' appear instantly in the table below the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: After searching, Jamie wants only active leads, so he applies a status filter.
narrative_steps.action: Click the filter icon, select 'Active' from the status dropdown, then click 'Apply Filters'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only leads matching both the keyword 'John' and status 'Active' remain visible in the table.

requirement_tested: Functionality for updating lead information including contact details and pipeline status
user_persona: A sales associate updating a prospect's progress.
user_goal: To update a lead’s phone number and change their pipeline stage.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Lead Details
narrative_steps.description: Taylor finds a lead named Alex Morgan and clicks on the row to modify contact info.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the lead row for Alex Morgan.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal or detail view opens showing Alex Morgan's lead information.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Information
narrative_steps.description: Taylor notices the phone number is outdated and decides to update it along with moving the lead forward.
narrative_steps.action: Click the edit icon, update the phone number to '+19876543210', change status to 'Qualified', then click Save.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The modal closes, and the lead list refreshes showing the new phone number and updated status for Alex Morgan.

requirement_tested: Automated message sending system for lead nurturing and communication
user_persona: Marketing coordinator configuring auto-emails for new leads.
user_goal: To set up automatic welcome emails when a new lead enters the system.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Up Automation Rule
narrative_steps.description: Casey goes to the messaging automation section to configure a welcome email triggered upon lead creation.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'New Lead Created' from the trigger event dropdown in the message template configuration.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The setting is saved automatically, and future leads will receive the configured welcome email immediately after being added.

requirement_tested: Lead organization and categorization features with customizable tags and segments
user_persona: Sales operations specialist grouping leads by industry.
user_goal: To assign a newly created 'Tech Industry' tag to several leads.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Custom Tag
narrative_steps.description: Jordan creates a new tag called 'Tech Industry' to classify technology-related leads.
narrative_steps.action: In the Tags sidebar, type 'Tech Industry' into the add-tag input and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The new tag appears in the tags list with a unique color badge next to it.

narrative_steps.title: Assigning Tags to Leads
narrative_steps.description: Jordan drags two tech leads onto the 'Tech Industry' tag to group them together.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the rows of two leads over the 'Tech Industry' tag label.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both leads now display the 'Tech Industry' tag, and filtering by this tag shows these two leads.

requirement_tested: Settings management interface for configuring application preferences and business rules
user_persona: CRM administrator adjusting company-wide notification settings.
user_goal: To enable daily digest emails for all users regarding new leads.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Settings
narrative_steps.description: Morgan accesses the global settings panel to adjust notification behavior.
narrative_steps.action: Click the settings gear icon in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser navigates to the Settings page which has sections like General, Notifications, Business Rules.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Notification Preferences
narrative_steps.description: Morgan enables the daily digest option under the Notifications section.
narrative_steps.action: Expand the Notifications panel, check the box for 'Daily Digest Emails', and click Save Changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All users begin receiving daily summary emails about new leads added during the previous day.

requirement_tested: Dropdown menu management system for maintaining configurable options and selections
user_persona: System admin updating the available lead statuses.
user_goal: To remove an obsolete status and add a new one used by the sales team.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Dropdown Management
narrative_steps.description: Riley navigates to the dropdown management area to update lead status options.
narrative_steps.action: Go to the admin section and open the Dropdown Editor tool.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An editable list of current dropdown values for lead status appears.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Dropdown Options
narrative_steps.description: Riley removes the old 'Pending Review' status and adds 'Follow-Up Scheduled'.
narrative_steps.action: Delete the 'Pending Review' item, add 'Follow-Up Scheduled' as a new entry, and save the changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Future lead forms reflect the updated list excluding 'Pending Review' and including 'Follow-Up Scheduled'.

requirement_tested: Reporting dashboard displaying sales metrics, lead conversion rates, and performance analytics
user_goal: To analyze how many leads were converted last month.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Conversion Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Patricia visits the reporting dashboard to assess team performance last month.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Reports link in the main navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dashboard loads showing various charts including a conversion rate graph over time.

narrative_steps.title: Drilling Down Into Data
narrative_steps.description: Patricia clicks on the peak point of the conversion chart to get more details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the highest bar in the conversion chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A detailed breakdown appears showing exactly which leads converted on that date and what stages they passed through.

requirement_tested: Advice and guidance section providing best practices for CRM usage and integration tips
user_persona: New hire learning how to use the CRM effectively.
user_goal: To read about recommended ways to follow up with leads.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Best Practice Tips
narrative_steps.description: Dana looks for tips on improving her follow-up strategy with potential clients.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Best Practices' tab in the help section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Articles related to CRM usage appear, including one titled 'Effective Follow-Up Strategies'.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Advice Content
narrative_steps.description: Dana clicks on the article she found interesting to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the title 'Effective Follow-Up Strategies'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The full article content expands or loads on a new page with actionable advice for Dana.

requirement_tested: User authentication and authorization system for secure access control
user_persona: Employee logging in remotely to access CRM resources.
user_goal: To securely access the CRM dashboard using personal credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Login Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Sam arrives at work and needs to log into the CRM to start tracking leads.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the login page, enter correct username and password, and click Log In.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Sam is redirected to the CRM dashboard with personalized access rights applied.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design with papaya whip background and dark orange styled components
user_persona: Mobile user accessing CRM on a tablet during a client visit.
user_goal: To navigate the CRM smoothly on a mobile device while retaining visual branding.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Site on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Chris opens the CRM website on his iPad to review lead notes before meeting a prospect.
narrative_steps.action: Open Safari and go to the CRM URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site renders responsively with layout optimized for touchscreens, background colored #FFEFD5, and buttons/styling in #FF8C00.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'install:all' script for simultaneous frontend and backend dependency installation
user_persona: Developer setting up the project locally for the first time.
user_goal: To install all dependencies for both frontend and backend with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clones the repo and wants to prepare everything needed to run the app locally.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend are installed concurrently without errors, preparing the entire stack for development.

requirement_tested: Development environment setup with 'dev' script to run frontend and backend concurrently
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend services with a single command for efficient workflow.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Alex is ready to code and wants to spin up both the frontend and backend servers.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` in the root project folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two servers start simultaneously—one hosting the frontend on port 3000 and the other running the backend API on port 3001.
